triples.name: Integer programming
triples.relevance: Mixed integer programming is the core optimization problem formulation for the instances in MIPLIB 2017

triples.name: Mathematical optimization
triples.relevance: The paper uses mixed integer optimization to encode selection requirements in the data-driven compilation process

triples.name: Benchmarking
triples.relevance: The paper explicitly creates a benchmarking subset of 240 instances specifically selected for measuring solver performance

triples.name: Solver
triples.relevance: The paper evaluates MIP solver performance using the selected instances and uses solver performance data in the selection process

triples.name: Instance selection
triples.relevance: The paper introduces a novel data-driven instance selection process to compile MIPLIB 2017 from 5721 candidate instances
